intro: Lippia turnerifolia var. turnerifolia, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional herbal medicine. The species is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
